text: EDF is one of the UK's leading uh low
carbon uh energy generators in the UK uh
we Supply about 5 a half million homes
and businesses across the UK EDF in the
UK has been a large scale user of AWS
for at least the last 10 11 years um
we've gone through a recent uh evolution
of our AWS usage in the last 3 to four
years um by building up a devops
capability it creates a more Federated
use of AWS so that the teams are
accountable for running their own AWS
accounts and services within there but
it did present us with a challenge
around observability uh and how we
enable those teams to support and run
and optimize their assets and that's
where we partnered with with AWS and and
Dino Trace we brought them in to uh help
us build up a dino Trace deployment with
that deployment it's allowed us to um
triage incidents much quicker it's
allowed us to understand how the
customers are interacting the EDF
customers are seeing more reliable
Services we're able to detect things
quicker we're able to fix them quicker
we're able to understand more about the
customer insight as well how the
customers are using the services what
functions are working well for them what
they're not I think the collaboration
will continue um we we've created a
great engineering community within our
customers business and we're looking to
replicate and scale that across the rest
of the EDF qk operation
